snippet: A state district judge on Friday threw out a lawsuit claiming that Senator Mary L. Landrieu lives full time in Washington and cannot represent Louisiana, saying it was premature.
abstract: Louisiana State District Judge Wilson Fields dismisses challenge to Senator Mary L Landrieu’s bid for re-election in Louisiana, ruling that lawsuit questioning her residency is premature; State Rep Paul Hollis claimed Landrieu, a Democrat, lived full time in Washington and could not represent Louisiana because she was not a state resident; Hollis, a Republican, had briefly considered a run against Landrieu.
lead_paragraph: A state district judge on Friday threw out a lawsuit claiming that Senator Mary L. Landrieu lives full time in Washington and cannot represent Louisiana, saying it was premature.

headline.main: Louisiana Judge Rejects Suit Over Landrieu’s Residency
headline.print_headline: Louisiana Judge Rejects Suit Over Landrieu’s Residency
